dialogue_line_replacements.text: Me gusta bien escuchar música y salir con los panas.
dialogue_line_replacements.translation: I really like listening to music and going out with my friends.

dialogue_line_replacements.text: Sí, me encanta el béisbol, pero no me gusta nada el fútbol.
dialogue_line_replacements.translation: Yes, I love baseball, but I don't like football at all.

dialogue_line_replacements.text: Me gusta la salsa y el reggaeton. ¿Y tú?
dialogue_line_replacements.translation: I like salsa and reggaeton. And you?

cultural_notes_overrides.formality: In Puerto Rico, 'bien' is used as an intensifier instead of 'muy': 'me gusta bien' = 'I really like it'. Baseball (béisbol) is the most popular sport — Puerto Rico has a proud professional league and has produced many MLB stars.
cultural_notes_overrides.gestures: Enthusiastic nodding and 'sí, sí, sí' signals strong agreement/liking. Sucking teeth and waving the hand dismissively signals dislike.
cultural_notes_overrides.regional_variations: 'Los panas' means friends/buddies in PR. 'Chévere' and 'brutal' both mean great/awesome. Salsa music is deeply tied to Puerto Rican identity — it's not just liked, it's a cultural pillar. Reggaeton originated in Puerto Rico.
